comments.content: You HAVE to rename since length limitation is 20 characters on assignable sets. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/business-central/dev-itpro/developer/devenv-permissionset-object

discussion.content:
1. because no other option works, so change the permission set object name to Sales person
2. Assignable = True
3. Publish the app with permission set to the environment

1. Rename
2. Assignable = true
3. Publish the app with permission set to an environment.

I'm not sure but I think is correcto the answer
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/business-central/dev-itpro/developer/devenv-permissionset-composing

Change the Assignable property value to true.
 Add the ObsoleteState = No property.
 Publish the app with the permission set to an environment.

discussion.content: Permissions = tabledata "Boxes" = rm;
I Agred
Sandboxes are not available for the onPrem version of BC

Run on the company hardware -- On premises
Use sandbox environment for Extension -- Online
Allow connection to Shopify -- Online
Create workflow --Online
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/business-central/dev-itpro/features-not-implemented-on-premises

Connect to Shopify Online tenants can connect their Shopify store (or stores) with Business Central and maximize their business productivity. The Shopify connector is not supported for on-premises deployments. For more information, see Get Started with the Shopify Connector.

Create workflow from Power Automate Power Automate does not integrate with on-premises workflow functionality. You can't create new workflows based on existing Power Automate templates in on-premises deployments of Business Central.

The question is tricky. It didn't mention whether it's an online sandbox or a container sandbox. As such, both Cloud and on-premise are achievable.
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/business-central/dev-itpro/developer/devenv-sandbox-overview#development-sandbox-overview

Company hardware requirement: On-premises
Sandbox environments for development: Cloud
Shopify connector: Cloud
Power Automate integration: Cloud

Run on the company hardware -- On premises
Use sandbox environment for Extension -- Online
Allow connection to Shopify -- Online
Create workflow --Online

Run on the company hardware -- On premises
Use sandbox environment for Extension -- Online
Allow connection to Shopify -- Online
Create workflow --Online

Run on the company hardware -- On premises
Use sandbox environment for Extension -- Online
Allow connection to Shopify -- Online
Create workflow --Online

RTA: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/business-central/dev-itpro/developer/devenv-sandbox-overview
Sandbox is on cloud...

I think it could be correct that you can use sandbox environment in on-prem, maybe means that you can run applications in isolated environment:

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/security/application-security/application-isolation/windows-sandbox/windows-sandbox-overview
Use Microsoft Power Automate to create a workflow that calls a business event - I think that should work in both OnPrem and Cloud.
Sandboxes are only for cloud.

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
A company plans to deploy Business Central.
The company has the following deployment requirements:
Use the company hardware architecture to run the deployment.
Use sandbox environments to develop extensions.
Allow tenants to connect to Shopify with the standard connector.
Use Microsoft Power Automate to create a workflow that calls a business event.
You need to identify the deployment type for each requirement.
Which deployment types should you use? To answer, move the appropriate deployment types to the correct requirements. You may use each deployment type once, more than once, or not at all. You may need to move the split bar between panes or scroll to view content.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
//IMG//

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Correct

Selected Answer: U
Test codeunits are codeunits that have the SubType Property set to Test. You write tests as AL code in the methods inside of the test codeunits. There are three types of methods that you can add in a test codeunit: test, handler, and normal. Each method type is used for a specific purpose and behaves differently. When a test codeunit runs, it runs the OnRun trigger, and then runs each test method in the codeunit.

questions.question_text:
You plan to write unit test functions to test newly developed functionality in an app.
You must create a test codeunit to write the functions.
You need to select the property to use for the test codeunit.
Which property should you use to ensure that the requirements are fulfilled?

DRAG DROP -
A company owns and operates hotels, restaurants, and stores.
When the staff orders materials from the purchasing department, the requests are not directed to the correct approvers.
The staff requires a new field named Approver from which they can select the appropriate approver. The field must include the following options:

Hotel manager -

Restaurant manager -

Store manager -

Purchasing manager -
You need to create the Approver field in the Item table by using an AL extension.
Which three actions should you perform in sequence? To answer, move the appropriate actions from the list of actions to the answer area and arrange them in the correct order.
//IMG//
